System.out.println("No save file found, starting a new one");
* Constructor: reads a line from input and stores it as a list of Strongs
* This would usually contain the description of the task
* @return the 2nd word of the input if there is one, else returns a empty string
* Retrieve the first word of the input
* @return the first word of the input
* This method is used to get the the integer for tasks such as delete and markdone
* @return an int value of the tasklist for the command which we want to operate on
* @return the description of the Todo task
* Splits the deadline into 2 strings, the description and the deadline
* @throws DukeException when either no description or deadline
* Splits the event input into 2 strings, the description and the event
*  Gets the unicode icon for a tick or cross
* @return unicode icon for a tick or cross
* turns isDone from false to true;
System.out.println(" Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n" + currTask.toString());
public static void printDeleted(Task currTask, List<Task> taskList) {
System.out.println("Noted. I've removed this task:\n" + currTask.toString() + "\nNow you have " + (taskList.size() - 1) + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
public static void printTodo(Todo todo, List<Task> taskList) {

System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:
" + todo.toString() + "
Now you have " + taskList.size() + " tasks in the list.
");
public static void printDeadline(Deadline deadline, List<Task> taskList) {

System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:
" + deadline.toString() + "
Now you have " + taskList.size() + " tasks in the list.
");
public static void printEvent(Event event, List<Task> taskList) {

System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:
" + event.toString() + "
Now you have " + taskList.size() + " tasks in the list.
");
